Annotation.note:
The sides $BC$, $CA$, $AB$ of a triangle $ABC$ are met by two transversals $PQR$, $STU$ in the pairs of points $P$, $S$; $Q$, $T$; $R$, $U$. Show that the intersection points of the lines $BC$, $QU$; $CA$, $RS$; $AB$, $PT$ are collinear.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
